Uses of Interface
es.csic.iiia.bms.Factor

Packages that use Factor
es.csic.iiia.bms Implementation of the binarized max-sum algorithm as interactions between factors. 
es.csic.iiia.bms.factors Efficient implementations of some particular higher-order factors. 
 

Uses of Factor in es.csic.iiia.bms

Uses of Factor in es.csic.iiia.bms.factors
 

Classes in es.csic.iiia.bms.factors that implement Factor
 class AbstractFactor<T>
          Skeletal implementation of a Max-Sum factor.
 class AbstractTwoSidedFactor<T>
          Abstract class for two-sided factors.
 class AllActiveIncentiveFactor<T>
          A factor that (de)incentivizes a group of variables (from being) to be all on.
 class AtMostOneFactor<T>
          Max-sum "at most one" factor.
 class CardinalityFactor<T>
          Cardinality factor.
 class CompositeIndependentFactor<T>
          Deprecated.  
 class ConditionedSelectorFactor<T>
          Max-sum conditioned selector factor.
 class EqualityFactor<T>
          Equality constraint, that tries to ensure that all variables have the same value.
 class ImplicationFactor<T>
          Max-sum "Implication" factor.
 class IndependentFactor<T>
          Factor that includes an independent cost/utility for each of the variables in its scope (its neighbors).
 class ProxyFactor<T>
          Skeletal implementation of a factor that relays (possibly modified) messages into/out of another wrapped factor.
 class SaturationFactor<T>
          Factor that selects the best active neighbor but doesn't constraint others.
 class SaturationKFactor<T>
          Factor that selects the best k active neighbor but doesn't constraint others.
 class SelectorFactor<T>
          Max-sum selector factor.
 class SingleWeightFactor<T>
          Factor that composes (sums) an independent cost/utility for each neighbor with some other inner (non-independent) factor.
 class StandardFactor<T>
          Implementation of a standard (binary) max-sum factor.
 class TwoSidedEqualityFactor<T>
          Max-sum "Two-sided equality" factor.
 class TwoSidedReserveFactor<T>
          Max-sum "Two-sided reserve" factor.
 class VariableFactor<T>
          Factor defined over a single variable (variable node in classical MaxSum).
 class WeightingFactor<T>
          Factor that composes (sums) an independent cost/utility for each neighbor with some other inner (non-independent) factor.
 

Methods in es.csic.iiia.bms.factors that return Factor
 Factor<T> ProxyFactor.getInnerFactor()
          Get the internal factor we are proxying to/from.
 Factor<T> CompositeIndependentFactor.getInnerFactor()
          Deprecated. Get the inner (non-independent) factor of this composition.
 

Methods in es.csic.iiia.bms.factors with parameters of type Factor
 void CompositeIndependentFactor.setInnerFactor(Factor<T> innerFactor)
          Deprecated. Set the inner (non-independent) factor of this composition.
 

Constructors in es.csic.iiia.bms.factors with parameters of type Factor
ProxyFactor(Factor<T> innerFactor)
          Build a new proxy factor that relays messages to/from the given inner factor.
SingleWeightFactor(Factor<T> innerFactor)
          Build a new weighting factor with the specified inner factor.
WeightingFactor(Factor<T> innerFactor)
          Build a new weighting factor with the specified inner factor.
